p:
Plasma will be collected by apheresis from patients recently recovered from laboratory confirmed infection by SARS-CoV-2 (either hospitalised or self-isolated at home) with the following characteristics:
-
at least 14 days from clinical recovery of the patient (no symptoms) and with a negative result of two NAT tests on nasopharyngeal swab and on serum/plasma, performed 24 h apart, following recovery or prior to discharge if hospitalized;
-
not mandatory (and not required by the majority of protocols in place) is a further negative result of a NAT testing on a nasopharyngeal swab and on serum/plasma, performed 14 days after the first one;
-
an adequate serum titer of specific neutralizing antibodies (>160 by EIA method or equivalent with other methods, as previously suggested [ [15], [16], [17]]).
